Table 6: Number of pre-training epochs vs. perfor-
mance. Results are obtained for ImageNet linear evalua-
tion.

Table 5. We notice 
NNCLR achieves 68.2% top-1 performance on the Ima-
geNet linear evaluation task suffering a performance drop 
of only 4.7%. On the other hand, SimCLR and BYOL suf-
fer larger relative drops in performance, 27.6% and 13.1% 
respectively. The performance drop reduces further as we 
train our approach longer. With 1000 pre-training epochs, 
NNCLR with all augmentations achieves 74.9% while with 
only random crops NNCLR manages to get 73.3%, further 
reducing the gap to just 1.6%. While NNCLR also benefits 
from complex data augmentation operations, the reliance on 
color jitter and blurring operations is much less. This is en-
couraging for adopting NNCLR for pre-training in domains 
where data transformations used for ImageNet might not be 
suitable.
